intro: Tabernaemontana rupicola var. poeppigii, commonly known as the rock tabernanthe, is a rare and ornamental plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range from white to pink and are often fragrant. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and prefers well-drained conditions. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
